text:
**Season 2 of MLC**: The second season of MLC has kicked off with a rematch between MI New York and Seattle Orcas, following a successful first season that exceeded financial targets with revenues of $8 million.

**Expanding Reach**: The tournament has secured major sponsorship deals, including a title sponsorship with Cognizant, and has received official T20 league status, with tournament playing records counted towards format statistics.

**Player Contracts**: Top players will earn around $175,000 for a minimum of five games, rivaling figures in other T20 leagues outside of the Indian Premier League. Stars from Australia, including Pat Cummins, will participate in this season's MLC.

**Future Plans**: There are plans to expand MLC, with Chicago and Atlanta touted as possible new franchises, and a longer tournament earmarked to be played over much of June and July in the future.

**Challenges**: Despite the progress, MLC faces challenges, including governance issues with USA Cricket, the sport's governing body in the US.

**Fanbase**: MLC has an invested fanbase, with cricket broadcaster Willow reaching around 4-5 million homes, translating to a fanbase of around 10 million people. The tournament hopes to ride the momentum generated by the recent T20 World Cup.

**Match Details**

* Match 1: MI New York vs Seattle Orcas
* Date: July 5, 2024 (Friday)
* Time: 3:30 pm Local time (July 6, 1:00 AM)
* Venue: Church Street Park, North Carolina, United States

**Background**

* This is the second edition of the Major League Cricket tournament.
* MI New York is the defending champion, having won the inaugural season in 2023 against Seattle Orcas in the final.
* MI New York won the final by 7 wickets at the Grand Pierre Cricket stadium in Texas.

**Teams**

* MI New York: Nicholas Pooran, Shayan Jahangir, Nosthusha Kenjige, Dewald Brevis, Rushil Ugarkar, and others.
* Seattle Orcas: Nandre Burger, Harmeet Singh, Obed McCoy, Nathan Ellis, Shubham Ranjane, and others.

**Live Streaming**

* The Indian broadcast partners of the Major League Cricket 2024 are yet to be announced.
* Live streaming links are provided in the article.

The article announces that Willow by Cricbuzz will provide comprehensive coverage of the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) season, including live matches, streaming, and on-demand cricket content. The coverage will be available on Willow by Cricbuzz, regional sports networks, and free-to-view broadcasts on Sunday nights. The partnered regional sports networks include Monumental Sports Network, YES Network, ROOT SPORTS, Bally Sports Southwest, and Bally Sports SoCal. 

Three Sunday night matches, scheduled for July 7, 14, and 21, will be available for free viewing on various platforms, including Willow by Cricbuzz, Cricbuzz app, Sling Freestream, and Fubo TV. The matches include Los Angeles Knight Riders vs. San Francisco Unicorns, MI New York vs. Texas Super Kings, and MI New York vs. Los Angeles Knight Riders.

* The opening match of Major League Cricket is taking place in North Texas.
* This event will bring cricket action to the center stage in North Texas.

**Tournament Overview**: The second season of the MLC is set to take place from July 5 to 28, with 25 matches to be played.

**TV and Streaming**: All matches will be broadcast on Sony Sports Network on TV in India, with day matches starting at 12:30/1 AM IST and evening matches at 6 AM IST. The matches will also be available for live streaming on the JioCinema app and website.

**Squads**: The article lists the squads for the six teams participating in the tournament: MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom. Notable players and coaches mentioned include Steve Smith, Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Glenn Maxwell, Ricky Ponting, and Shane Watson.

**Anticipation and Expectation**: The article suggests that the tournament is expected to benefit from the recent success of the US national cricket team in the T20 World Cup, and that there is growing excitement and anticipation around the MLC's second season.

**Match Result:** MI New York won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the opening match of the MLC 2024 season.

**Score:** Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs, and MI New York chased down the target in 14.2 overs with 34 balls to spare.

**Top Performers:** Nicholas Pooran top-scored for MI New York with an unbeaten 62 off 37 balls, while Rashid Khan and Trent Boult took three wickets each for MI New York.

**Key Moments:** Pooran's power-hitting turned the tide in MI New York's favor, while Boult's early breakthroughs and Rashid Khan's regular wickets restricted Seattle Orcas to a low score.

**Other Notable Performances:** Shubham Ranjane was the highest run-getter for Seattle Orcas with 35 runs in 31 balls, and Harmeet Singh played a 20-run cameo for the Orcas.

**Match Details:**

* Date: Saturday, July 6, 2024, and Sunday, July 7, 2024
* Time: Various times depending on region (listed in the article)
* Venue: Church Street Park, Morrisville, North Carolina, United States
* Weather: 36°C or 96.8°F with heavy showers expected

**Teams:**

* Washington Freedom: Captained by Steve Smith, featuring Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Andrew Tye, Jack Edwards, Akeal Hosein, Marco Jansen, Rachin Ravindra, Saurabh Netravalkar, Andries Gous, and Lockie Ferguson
* MI New York: Defending champions, featuring Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, and Rashid Khan

**Recent Form:**

* Washington Freedom: LLWWW
* MI New York: WWWL

**Predictions and Betting Analysis:**

* Travis Head is expected to score quickly at the top of the order for Washington Freedom
* Andrew Tye may take two or more wickets for Washington Freedom
* Nicholas Pooran is expected to continue his fine form and score 30 or more for MI New York
* Trent Boult or Rashid Khan may take two or more wickets for MI New York
* Expert prediction: Nicholas Pooran to top score in the match.

**Match Details:**
The opening match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season will be played between the San Francisco Unicorns and the Los Angeles Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas on July 7, 2024.

**Teams:**
The San Francisco Unicorns, coached by Shane Watson and captained by Corey Anderson, are looking to improve on their disappointing first season where they missed out on the playoffs due to net run rate. The team consists of experienced players like Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Liam Plunkett, with West Indian all-rounder Sherfane Rutherford being the star attraction.

The Los Angeles Knight Riders, affiliated with the Indian Premier League side Kolkata Knight Riders, had a poor first season, finishing last with a slender two-wicket defeat against the league winners Seattle Orcas. They are looking to bounce back this season.

**Key Players:**
For the San Francisco Unicorns, Jake Fraser-McGurk is expected to be a leading light in their batting lineup, while Pat Cummins will be key to their bowling attack.

For the Los Angeles Knight Riders, David Miller is expected to be their best batter, while Adam Zampa's spin bowling will be crucial to their success.

**Expert Prediction:**
The San Francisco Unicorns are expected to have the better of the powerplay and higher opening stand due to their strong pace-bowling attack and the Los Angeles Knight Riders' weaknesses at the top of the order.

**Tournament Details:**

* The MLC 2024 tournament will be broadcast live on the Sony Sports Network in India, and streamed live on JioCinema.
* The tournament will feature six teams: MI New York, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and Texas Super Kings.

**Schedule:**

* The tournament will take place from July 6 to July 29.
* A total of 19 matches will be played, with the final scheduled for July 29.
* The schedule includes five matches each for the first six days, followed by the eliminator, qualifier, challenger, and final matches.

**Teams and Squads:**

* The six teams and their squads are listed in the article, featuring prominent players like Sunil Narine, Kieron Pollard, Corey Anderson, Wayne Parnell, and Faf du Plessis.

This summary provides an overview of the MLC 2024 tournament, including the broadcast details, schedule, and team squads.

**Tournament Details**

* The second season of MLC starts on July 5 and ends on July 28, with a total of 25 matches.
* The tournament will be played at two venues: Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas, and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

**Teams**

* There are six teams participating: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
* IPL franchises own four teams in the MLC, while Seattle Orcas are owned by the GMR Group, and Washington Freedom have Cricket New South Wales as their high-performance partner.

**Big Names**

* 23 overseas players who played in the inaugural season will return, including Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, Heinrich Klaasen, and Kieron Pollard.
* New signings include Pat Cummins, Travis Head, Steven Smith, Daryl Mitchell, Shakib Al Hasan, and Romario Shepherd.

**Local Heroes**

* USA cricketers who will participate in the tournament include Monank Patel, Noshthush Kenjige, Shayan Jahangir, Aaron Jones, Harmeet Singh, Milind Kumar, Andries Gous, and Saurabh Netravalkar.

**Format**

* The tournament will follow a round-robin league stage, where each team will play seven matches.
* The top two teams will meet in the Qualifier, with the winners advancing to the final.
* The third and fourth-placed teams will meet in the Eliminator, with the winner facing the team that loses the Qualifier in the Challenger.

**Official Status**

* MLC has been given List A status by the ICC, making it an official T20 league.
* Tournament playing records will now be counted as official format statistics.

**Scheduling Conflicts**

* There will be a clash with the Lanka Premier League, which ends on July 21, and the Hundred, which means 12 players may arrive late in the UK.

* The Los Angeles Knight Riders, led by Sunil Narine, secured their first win of the MLC 2024 season by defeating the Texas Super Kings by 12 runs.
* Ali Khan, representing the Knight Riders, took 4/33 in his four overs against the Super Kings.
* The Knight Riders posted a total of 162/7, with Unmukt Chand top-scoring with 68 runs, and then restricted the Super Kings to 150/8 to defend their total.
* The article highlights the best bowling performances in MLC history, with Saurabh Netravalkar holding the record with 6/9 for Washington Freedom against San Francisco Unicorns in 2023.
* The top five bowling figures in MLC competition are listed, with Wayne Parnell, Mohammad Mohsin, Trent Boult, and Cameron Gannon also featuring in the list.
* The MLC 2024 season started on July 5, and the schedule and results can be followed online.

* The tournament features six teams competing to become champions.

**Previous Winner**

* MI New York, an offshoot of the IPL franchise Mumbai Indians, won the first edition of MLC in 2023.

**Tournament Details**

* The second season of MLC, MLC 2024, will start on July 5 and end on July 28.
* Six teams - MI New York, LA Knight Riders, Texas Super Kings, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, and Washington Freedom - will compete in a 21-match round-robin format.
* The top four teams will qualify for the playoffs, which will consist of the Eliminator, Qualifier, Challenger, and the final.

**Schedule**

* The league phase will take place from July 5 to July 23, with 23 days of action.
* A total of 25 matches will be played across two venues - Church Street Park in Morrisville and Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.
* The first 15 matches will be split between the two venues, while the final six round-robin matches and the playoffs will be held in Dallas, Texas.

**Broadcast Details**

* In India, the tournament will be broadcast on Sony Sports Network via Sony Sports TEN 1 channels, with live streaming available on JioCinema.
* In Pakistan, the tournament will be telecast live on A Sports.
* The broadcast list for other regions is also provided in the article.

**Start Date:** The MLC tournament is set to start on Independence Day, July 4th, in the USA.

**Teams:** The tournament will feature six returning teams, including MI New York and Seattle Orcas, with top T20 stars like Rashid Khan and Quinton de Kock in action.

**Coverage:** Willow by Cricbuzz will provide extensive coverage of the tournament, with three Sunday night matches to be broadcasted for free to enhance accessibility and fan engagement.

**Objective:** The league aims to build on the momentum of the USA's recent T20 World Cup performance, establish a strong connection with local communities, and expand its fan base through strategic partnerships and free broadcasts.

**Introduction**: MLC is a T20 franchise tournament played in the United States of America, consisting of six teams.

**Duration**: The 2024 edition of MLC will take place from July 5 to July 28, with all 25 matches being played in Morrisville and Dallas.

**Format**: Teams will play each other twice in the group stage, and the top four teams will progress to the playoffs. The winner of the Challenger will face the winner of the Qualifier in the final.

**Previous Edition**: MI New York won the previous edition, beating Seattle Orcas by seven wickets in the final.

**Teams and Captains/Coaches**:

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Captain - Sunil Narine, Head Coach - Phil Simmons
* MI New York: Captain - Kieron Pollard, Head Coach - Robin Peterson
* San Francisco Unicorns: Captain - Corey Anderson, Head Coach - Shane Watson
* Seattle Orcas: Captain - Wayne Parnell, Head Coach - Pravin Amre
* Texas Super Kings: Captain - Faf du Plessis, Head Coach - Stephen Fleming
* Washington Freedom: Captain - Steven Smith, Head Coach - Ricky Ponting

**Team Composition**: Each team can have a minimum of 16 players and a maximum of 19, with no more than nine overseas players.

**Overseas Players Retained**: The article lists the overseas players retained by each team from the previous edition.

**Local Players**: Thirteen of the US' 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup 2024 will participate in MLC 2024.

**New Additions**: Notable new additions to MLC 2024 include Pat Cummins, Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Steven Smith, and Jake Fraser-Mcgurk.

**Official T20 Status**: All matches played in MLC 2024 will be counted as official T20s, thanks to the ICC granting List A status to the tournament.

**Broadcast**: Indian viewers can watch MLC 2024 on Jio Cinema, but it will not be telecast on any TV channel.

**Future Plans:**

* MLC has acquired List A status from the ICC, making it the second associate-run franchise competition to do so.
* The league plans to expand from six teams to 10 teams in the future, with the aim of increasing the number of games from 25 to 34 by 2025.

**Tournament**: Major League Cricket 2024
**Start Date**: July 5 (July 6 in Indian Standard Time)
**Location**: United States of America
**Significance**: Expected to produce stars for the future, following a historic Super 8 qualification for US fans in 2024.

**Start Date:** The MLC season 2 will begin on Friday, July 5.

**Teams and Captains:** The tournament will feature six teams: MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, San Francisco Unicorns, and Washington Freedom. The team captains are Kieron Pollard, Wayne Parnell, Faf Du Plessis, Sunil Narine, Corey Anderson, and Steve Smith.

**Player Lineup:** The teams have assembled their squads through retention and drafts, featuring a mix of international stars, rising talents, and American players from Minor League Cricket. Notable players include Nicholas Pooran, Dwayne Bravo, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Pat Cummins, Trent Boult, and Kagiso Rabada, among others.

**American Players:** Some players from the USA team that played in the recent T20 World Cup, such as Aaron Jones, Chaitanya Bishnoi, and Sunny Patel, will also participate in the tournament.

**Match Result:** MI New York won by 6 wickets against Seattle Orcas in the opening match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket season.

**Score:** Seattle Orcas 108/10 (19.1 ov), MI New York 111/4 (14.2 ov)

**Key Performances:** Nicholas Pooran (MI New York) scored an unbeaten 62 off 37 balls, while Rashid Khan and Trent Boult (both MI New York) took three wickets each.

**Match Summary:** Seattle Orcas struggled to score runs, with only Shubham Ranjane (35) and Harmeet Singh (20) making notable contributions. MI New York's bowlers, led by Boult and Khan, restricted the Orcas to 108 runs. In response, Pooran's power-hitting helped MI New York chase down the target in just 14.2 overs, losing four wickets in the process.

**Notable Mentions:** Cameron Gannon (Seattle Orcas) took two early wickets, but Pooran's hitting turned the tide in MI New York's favor. Kieron Pollard (MI New York) remained unbeaten on 8, supporting Pooran in the chase.

The inaugural match of the Major League Cricket 2024 will be played between MI New York and Seattle Orcas on July 6 at the Church Street Park in Morrisville. The match will start at 01:00 AM IST (Indian Standard Time). Cricket fans in India can watch the match on Sony Sports Network channels or stream it on the Jio Cinema app, which has the official broadcasting and streaming rights for the tournament, respectively.

**Match Result:** Los Angeles Knight Riders won by 12 runs against Texas Super Kings in the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

**Scorecard:**

* Los Angeles Knight Riders: 162/7 (20 ov)
* Texas Super Kings: 150/8 (20 ov)

**Top Performers:**

* Unmukt Chand (LA Knight Riders): 68 off 45 balls
* Ali Khan (LA Knight Riders): 4 wickets for 33 runs

**Match Summary:**

The match was played on July 6, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. Texas Super Kings won the toss and opted to bowl first. Los Angeles Knight Riders struggled early on, losing two wickets in the third over. However, Unmukt Chand's brilliant 68 off 45 balls helped the Knight Riders post a total of 162/7 in 20 overs. In response, the Texas Super Kings began cautiously, but lost wickets regularly, with Ali Khan taking four wickets to restrict them to 150/8, resulting in a 12-run win for the LA Knight Riders.

**MI New York vs Seattle Orcas:**

* MI New York won by 6 wickets, defending their title in the opening match of the 2024 season.
* Nicholas Pooran scored an unbeaten 62 off 37 balls, helping MI New York chase down 109 in 14.2 overs.
* Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108, with Rashid Khan and Trent Boult taking 3 wickets each.

**LA Knight Riders vs Texas Super Kings:**

* LA Knight Riders won by 12 runs in the second match of the 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket.
* Unmukt Chand scored 68 off 45 balls, powering LA Knight Riders to 162/7 in their allotted 20 overs.
* Ali Khan took 4 wickets for 33 runs, restricting Texas Super Kings to 150/8 and clinching the win for LA Knight Riders.

**Match Details**: The second match of MLC 2024 will be played between Texas Super Kings (TEX) and Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAS) on July 5, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Head-to-Head**: Texas Super Kings have a 1-0 lead in head-to-head matches, having won the only previous encounter between the two teams in the 2023 edition.

**Venue and Pitch Report**: The match will be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, which is a high-scoring venue with a fast outfield. The pitch is good for batting, but pacers may get some help under light conditions.

**Teams**: The predicted XIs for the match are: Texas Super Kings - Devon Conway, Faf du Plessis (c), Aiden Markram (vc), Marcus Stoinis, Aaron Hardie, DJ Bravo, Mitchell Santner, Naveen-ul-Haq, Noor Ahmad, Gerald Coetzee, Matheesha Pathirana; Los Angeles Knight Riders - Sunil Narine (vc), Jason Roy, David Miller, Shakib Al Hasan, Andre Russell (c), Nitish Kumar, Alex Carey (wk), Adithya Ganesh, Josh Little, Spencher Johnson, Ali Khan.

**Prediction**: The article predicts that Los Angeles Knight Riders will win the match, citing their strong team with several key all-rounders.

**Acquisition of Television Rights:** Sony Sports Network has acquired the exclusive television rights for the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in India for a period of one year.

**Tournament Schedule:** The second edition of the MLC will start on July 6, 2024, with the reigning champions MI New York facing Seattle Orcas in the opening match. The grand finale will be played on July 29, 2024, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

**Participating Teams and Players:** The tournament will feature six teams, including MI New York, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco Unicorns, Washington Freedom, Texas Super Kings, and Los Angeles Knight Riders. Popular cricketers like Quinton de Kock, Marcus Stoinis, and Nicholas Pooran are expected to participate in the tournament.

**Commentary Team:** The tournament will feature an all-star lineup of announcers, including Sunil Gavaskar, Wasim Akram, Danny Morrison, and others.

**Match Details**: The Texas Super Kings (TEX) will face the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAS) in the second game of MLC 2024 at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on July 5.

**Team Background**: TEX finished second in the league stage of the inaugural edition, while LAS had a disappointing campaign, finishing at the bottom of the table with only one win.

**Pitch Report**: The Grand Prairie Stadium is expected to favor batters, with a level and consistent playing surface. Bowlers can be effective if they bowl the right lengths.

**Head-to-Head Record**: Not mentioned in the article.

**Probable Playing 11**: The article lists the probable playing 11 for both teams, with TEX led by Faf du Plessis and LAS led by Sunil Narine.

* The opening match of MLC 2024 was played between MI New York and Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, New York.
* MI New York won the match by 6 wickets, chasing down the target of 109 runs in 14.2 overs.
* Seattle Orcas were bowled out for 108 runs in 19.1 overs, with Shubham Ranjan top-scoring with 35 runs.
* Trent Boult and Rashid Khan took 3 wickets each for MI New York, while Kieron Pollard chipped in with 2 wickets.
* Nicholas Pooran played a match-winning knock of 62 runs off 37 balls, including 7 fours and 2 sixes, to help MI New York win the match.
* Pooran's aggressive innings was the highlight of the chase, and he was named Player of the Match for his performance.
* MI New York's win was largely due to Pooran's brutal assault against Cameron Gannon in the fifth over, where he scored 22 runs and shifted the momentum of the match in his team's favor.

**Match Details:**
The match was played between the Texas Super Kings (TSK) and the Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

**Notable Performances:**

* Derone Davis of TSK took an extraordinary catch at third man, diving to his right and grabbing the rebound with his right hand, leaving the crowd in awe.
* Unmukt Chand of LAKR scored 68 off 45 balls, anchoring the innings and providing a solid foundation for his team.
* Ali Khan of LAKR took 4 wickets for 33 runs in his 4 overs, being the pick of the bowlers and helping his team win the match.

**Match Result:**
Los Angeles Knight Riders won the match by 12 runs, restricting Texas Super Kings to 150/8 in their 20 overs while scoring 162/7 themselves.
